metadata.name: Kyle Chapman
metadata.title: Full Stack Engineer
metadata.summary: I love learning new things and working on interesting projects
metadata.about: I started learning JavaScript to prepare for IT classes in school, only to realize that we were actually getting taught Java. Ever since then, I've learnt to read more carefully. Now I have more than 4 years of professional experience and still have the same passion to learn that I've had since that day.

experience.title: Full Stack Engineer
experience.description:
I am part of a team that is developing a **multi-tenant, e-commerce platform** that facilitates buying products from a **range of shops**. Supports **various payment methods** (iDEAL, Klarna, etc.) product returns, order tracking (DHL & PostNL), promotions, coupon codes, and more.

Some of my responsibilities are:
- **Development**: 50% frontend / 40% backend / 10% maintenance
- **Shop onboarding overhaul** to increase the number of shops onboarded
- Dashboard **UI/UX** updates to make it easier for shop owners to find the information they need
- **Prompt engineering** using OpenAI models to **automatically generate** product descriptions, about pages and more
- **Production** deployments
- Performing **code reviews**

experience.title: Lead Full Stack Engineer
experience.description:
After 7 months, I was promoted to **lead** the 3D website project.

As the **lead developer**, some of my responsibilities were:
- **Development**: 65% frontend / 30% backend / 5% maintenance
- Implementation of **Slack and Teams** integrations to join worlds from outside our website
- Implementation of **Sketchfab** integration to allow users to pull 3D models into their worlds
- Implementation of a fully-fledged **achievement system** to gamify the experience, which lead to a 21% increase in monthly active users (MAU).
- **Production** deployments
- Performing **code reviews**
- **Mentoring** new colleagues

experience.title: Full Stack Engineer
experience.description:
I was part of a team that was developing a **3D, social website** which allowed users to interact with each other (using voice and video) in a **shared** world, **editable** by admins of the world.

Some of my responsibilities were:
- **Development**: 50% frontend / 45% backend / 5% maintenance
- Implementation of an **editor system** so that worlds could be customizable, such as **changing the skybox** and **moving/scaling/rotating** objects in 3D space
- Implementation of a **chat system** that supported typing indicators, threads, emojis, message reactions and more
- Overhauled the **UI/UX** to make the website more visually appealing and easier to use

experience.title: Computer Science Tutor
experience.description: I was a **tutor** for second-year university students. I helped them **understand** the course work and created **mock exams** for them to test their skills. All of my students **passed** their final exams with ease.

experience.title: Frontend Engineer
experience.description: Developed a **visualization** for **geospatial data** using OpenLayers, which allowed a user to **interact** with a map of the **world**. Various data points could be plotted and played around with in order to visualize specific elements of the data points. I learnt a lot about **Vue** as a whole, how to integrate **OpenLayers** with Vue and all the quirks of **TypeScript** development.

experience.title: Backend Engineer
experience.description: Developed a **speaker identification** program, which took in an **audio recording** of multiple people speaking and output a folder for **each speaker** in the audio recording. I learnt a lot about the interaction between **Python** and **REST APIs**, and how to apply various **alterations to audio** so that the unique voices could be **separated**.

education.title: Bachelor of Science Honours degree in Computer Science (BScHons)
education.description:
Completed my **Bachelor of Science** degree in Mathematical Sciences in Computer Science, with an **honours** in **Computer Science**, in November 2020.

I worked on an **online tournament platform** that could host concurrent tournaments of the game "Othello". Players were put into **matches** to determine their **skill level**, and the **best players** were eventually put in matches to determine an **overall winner**.

It had the following functionality:
- User upload for a `.c` file containing player behaviour
- **Validation** of uploaded player file
- Matches scheduled in **round-robin** format
- **Automatically created** matches for **best players** once tournament finished
- **Analysis** of winning players

education.title: Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science (BSc)
education.description:
Completed my **Bachelor of Science** degree in Mathematical Sciences in **Computer Science** in November 2019.

I took **various classes** in fields such as data structures, algorithms, web development and computer networks, as well as **applied mathematics** classes in linear algebra, calculus, probability, and statistics.

projects.title: Personal Website
projects.description: Developed to complement my CV, as well as to showcase my skills and experience. Also it's nice to be able to say, "yeah I have a website". Previously, it was written in Vue, but I wanted to learn Next.js so I rewrote it.

projects.title: REST API for Personal Website
projects.description: Developed to fetch data for my personal website, instead of having to redeploy the website every time I want to change something. Hosted as a Cloudflare Worker, so that was pretty cool to learn about.

projects.title: Carbon Engine
projects.description: Developed a game engine in C++17 that uses the Vulkan API for rendering. It can only render a 2D triangle for now, but it was a fun project to work on in my free time. I had no prior experience with either C++ or Vulkan, so the only logical thing to do was to make a game engine from scratch, right?

projects.title: smath
projects.description: Developed a header-only C++ math library, similar to [GLM](https://github.com/g-truc/glm), written in C++17 that uses no external dependencies. For now, it supports vector and matrix operations, as well as converting between degrees and radians. Not production-ready yet, but a fun project to learn about how the math works behind the scenes. Like the [fast inverse square root](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_inverse_square_root).
